alert.note: Alert for DeKalb (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 22 at 1:13AM CDT by NWS Huntsville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern DeKalb County through 200 AM CDT... At 113 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Crossville, or 11 miles northeast of Boaz. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Crossville, Geraldine, Arona, Painter, Kilpatrick, Rodentown, Skirum and Lathamville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
